creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: scene of a calm bay with a few scattered boats; low blue and grey mountains in background; small cluster of houses and buildings nestled next to a rolling green hill at LR in foreground
inscription: left, cursive jizuri: 自摺　昭和五年作　瀬戸内海　静奈る日 {jizuri, Shōwa gonen saku, Seto naikai, Shizuka naru hi} | bottom, in pencil: A Calm Day | Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LLC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Inland Sea (Seto naikai 瀬戸内海) [second series]
title: A Calm Day
